summary: This bill, the "Promoting American Patriotism In Our Schools Act," aims to amend the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. It mandates the daily recitation of the Pledge of Allegiance, the prominent display of the American flag in classrooms and gymnasiums, and the incorporation of educational materials about the flag's history and significance into civics and history curricula within federally funded elementary and secondary schools. The bill includes an exception for individuals who choose not to recite the Pledge for religious or personal reasons and outlines certification and enforcement procedures.
